trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement User Interface - Reach Criterion
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement User Interface - Reach Criterion

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use targeting criteria to send push campaigns to a select subset of your users using Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use targeting criteria to send push campaigns to a select subset of your users using Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to use targeting criteria to send push campaigns to a select subset of your users
trans-unit.target: How to use targeting criteria to send push campaigns to a select subset of your users

trans-unit.source: Targeting your audience by specific criteria with the "New Criteria" button is one of the most powerful concepts in Azure Mobile Engagement that helps you send relevant push notifications that the customers will respond to instead of Spamming everyone.
trans-unit.target: Targeting your audience by specific criteria with the "New Criteria" button is one of the most powerful concepts in Azure Mobile Engagement that helps you send relevant push notifications that the customers will respond to instead of Spamming everyone.

trans-unit.source: You can limit your audience based on standard criteria and simulate pushes to determine how many people will receive the notification.
trans-unit.target: You can limit your audience based on standard criteria and simulate pushes to determine how many people will receive the notification.

trans-unit.source: UI Documentation - Reach - New Push Campaign
trans-unit.target: UI Documentation - Reach - New Push Campaign

trans-unit.source: **Technicals: ** You can target based on the same technical information you can see in the Analytics and Monitor sections.
trans-unit.target: **Technicals: ** You can target based on the same technical information you can see in the Analytics and Monitor sections.

trans-unit.source: **Location:** Applications that use "Real time location reporting" with Geo-Fencing can use Geo-Location as a criteria to target an audience from the GPS location.
trans-unit.target: **Location:** Applications that use "Real time location reporting" with Geo-Fencing can use Geo-Location as a criteria to target an audience from the GPS location.

trans-unit.source: "Lazy Area Location Reporting" call also be used to target an audience from the cell phone location ("Real time location reporting" and "Lazy Area Location Reporting" must be activated from the SDK).
trans-unit.target: "Lazy Area Location Reporting" call also be used to target an audience from the cell phone location ("Real time location reporting" and "Lazy Area Location Reporting" must be activated from the SDK).

trans-unit.source: **See also:** [SDK Documentation - iOS - Integration][Link 5], [SDK Documentation - Android - Integration][Link 5]
trans-unit.target: **See also:** [SDK Documentation - iOS - Integration][Link 5], [SDK Documentation - Android - Integration][Link 5]

trans-unit.source: **Reach Feedback:** You can target your audience based on their feedback from previous reach notifications through reach feedback from Announcements, Polls, and Data Pushes.
trans-unit.target: **Reach Feedback:** You can target your audience based on their feedback from previous reach notifications through reach feedback from Announcements, Polls, and Data Pushes.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to better target your audience after two or three reach campaigns than you could the first time.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to better target your audience after two or three reach campaigns than you could the first time.

trans-unit.source: It can also be used to filter out users who already received a notification with similar content, by setting a campaign to NOT be sent to users who already received a specific previous campaign.
trans-unit.target: It can also be used to filter out users who already received a notification with similar content, by setting a campaign to NOT be sent to users who already received a specific previous campaign.

trans-unit.source: You can even exclude users who are included a specific campaign that is still active from receiving new Pushes.
trans-unit.target: You can even exclude users who are included a specific campaign that is still active from receiving new Pushes.

trans-unit.source: **Install Tracking:** You can track information based on where your users installed your App.
trans-unit.target: **Install Tracking:** You can track information based on where your users installed your App.

trans-unit.source: **User Profile:** You can target based on standard user information and you can target based on the custom app info that you have created.
trans-unit.target: **User Profile:** You can target based on standard user information and you can target based on the custom app info that you have created.

trans-unit.source: This includes users who are currently logged in and users that have answered specific questions you have asked them to set in the app itself instead of just how they have responded to previous campaigns.
trans-unit.target: This includes users who are currently logged in and users that have answered specific questions you have asked them to set in the app itself instead of just how they have responded to previous campaigns.

trans-unit.source: All of your App Info's defined for your app show up on this list.
trans-unit.target: All of your App Info's defined for your app show up on this list.

trans-unit.source: Segments: You can also target based on segments that you have created based on specific user behavior containing multiple criteria.
trans-unit.target: Segments: You can also target based on segments that you have created based on specific user behavior containing multiple criteria.

trans-unit.source: All of your segments defined for your app show up on this list.
trans-unit.target: All of your segments defined for your app show up on this list.

trans-unit.source: **App Info:** Custom App Info Tags can be created from “Settings” to track user behavior.
trans-unit.target: **App Info:** Custom App Info Tags can be created from “Settings” to track user behavior.

trans-unit.source: If you want to push an announcements only to the sub-set of your users that have performed an in-app purchase action.
trans-unit.target: If you want to push an announcements only to the sub-set of your users that have performed an in-app purchase action.

trans-unit.source: Go to your application settings page, select the "App info" menu and select "New app ino"
trans-unit.target: Go to your application settings page, select the "App info" menu and select "New app ino"

trans-unit.source: Register a new Boolean app info called "inAppPurchase"
trans-unit.target: Register a new Boolean app info called "inAppPurchase"

trans-unit.source: Make your application set this app info to "true" when the user successfully perform an in-app purchase (by using the sendAppInfo("inAppPurchase", ...) function)
trans-unit.target: Make your application set this app info to "true" when the user successfully perform an in-app purchase (by using the sendAppInfo("inAppPurchase", ...) function)

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to do this from your application, you can do it from your backend by using the device API)
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to do this from your application, you can do it from your backend by using the device API)

trans-unit.source: Then, you just need to create your announcement, with a criterion limiting your audience to users having "inAppPurchase" set to "true")
trans-unit.target: Then, you just need to create your announcement, with a criterion limiting your audience to users having "inAppPurchase" set to "true")

trans-unit.source: Note: Targeting based on criteria other than app info tags requires Azure Mobile Engagement to gather information from your users' devices before the push is sent and so can cause a delay.
trans-unit.target: Note: Targeting based on criteria other than app info tags requires Azure Mobile Engagement to gather information from your users' devices before the push is sent and so can cause a delay.

trans-unit.source: Complex push configuration options (like updating badges) can also delay pushes.
trans-unit.target: Complex push configuration options (like updating badges) can also delay pushes.

trans-unit.source: Using a "one shot" campaign from the Push API is the absolute fastest push method in Azure Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: Using a "one shot" campaign from the Push API is the absolute fastest push method in Azure Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Using only app info tags as push criteria for a Reach campaign (either from the Reach API or the UI) is the next fastest method since app info tags are stored on the server side.
trans-unit.target: Using only app info tags as push criteria for a Reach campaign (either from the Reach API or the UI) is the next fastest method since app info tags are stored on the server side.

trans-unit.source: Using other targeting criteria for a push campaign is the most flexible but slowest push method since Azure Mobile Engagement has to query the devices in order to send the campaign.
trans-unit.target: Using other targeting criteria for a push campaign is the most flexible but slowest push method since Azure Mobile Engagement has to query the devices in order to send the campaign.

trans-unit.source: Last known area: Country, Region, Locality
trans-unit.target: Last known area: Country, Region, Locality

trans-unit.source: Real time geo-fencing: List of POIs (Name, Actions), Circular POI (Name, Latitude, Longitude, Radius in meters)
trans-unit.target: Real time geo-fencing: List of POIs (Name, Actions), Circular POI (Name, Latitude, Longitude, Radius in meters)

trans-unit.source: Poll answer feedback: Poll answer feedback, question, choice
trans-unit.target: Poll answer feedback: Poll answer feedback, question, choice

trans-unit.source: Data Push feedback: Data Push, feedback
trans-unit.target: Data Push feedback: Data Push, feedback

trans-unit.source: Name of Segments (from dropdown list), Exclusion (target users that are not a part of this segment).
trans-unit.target: Name of Segments (from dropdown list), Exclusion (target users that are not a part of this segment).
